title: [K-12] Web-based HTML Coding Learning Course Using Visual Models: Enhancing Digital Citizenship and Online Collaborative Relationships

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary computer skills and internet usage experience, basic understanding of digital society and online environments
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, focusing on understanding HTML structures and debugging skills through visual models. Emphasizes foundational technologies for digital citizenship and online collaborative relationships, supporting learners' growth as responsible members of digital society.

learning_goals: Learners connect HTML tags with web page output results at 80% accuracy using visual models (diagrams/arrows), strengthening logical expression skills and digital citizenship

Learners complete provided HTML tasks (e.g., basic page composition) within three attempts in a simulated environment, achieving over 70% accuracy in error correction to develop problem-solving skills and digital protocol compliance

Learners independently create a two-page static webpage with headers, body text, and at least three images using HTML/CSS over three weeks, achieving over 70 points on a peer assessment rubric (30% design, 40% functionality, 30% creativity) to demonstrate digital society participation and online collaborative relationship-building skills

resources: HTML debugging practice sample code set
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
